strings.Value: "Very well. We'll go back and collapse this passage."
"As you say, Tristian. Let's go back and collapse the passage."
"I will leave when I decide it's time to leave."
"Our people's safety comes first. We'll do as you say — let's go back and collapse the passage."
"I want to examine this part of sepulcher, Tristian. There's nothing wrong with that."
"If there's power to be had here, I shall make it serve me."
"Let's leave this place. Now." {n}Tristian is silent for a moment.{/n} "And we should collapse the entrance. So no one… ever..."

"This chamber... it..." {n}Tristian looks at you, but doesn't seem to see you — his eyes, normally calm, are troubled.{/n} "It is the heart of the evil that fills this whole tomb. Everything here bears traces of the ones Vordakai worshipped."
"I beg you, let us leave this place. I don't want you to suffer Vordakai's fate — you or anyone else. The powers of darkness are strong here. They can corrupt even the strongest of hearts."
{n}Tristian steps towards you.{/n} "I rarely insist, {name}, but you must turn back!" {n}He catches himself, and his voice drops.{/n} "I beg you… please. Turn back."
{n}Tristian keeps silent for a moment.{/n} "So be it. But I beg you — don't let the evil of this place tempt you."
